page.title: 15Excavation Near Mortimer
page.content: In July 1985 archaeologists are con- cluding a five year excavation at the amphitheatre of the Roman town of Calleva prior to the D.O.E. preserving the site as an Ancient Monument. They have uncovered an earth bank which would have seated 4,000 people on wooden seats. A flint wall separates the bank from the arena; holes in the walls drain rainwater away. The arena floor is lower than the surrounding land and is liable to flood; they are trying to find how the arena was drained. Children have visited the site and observed the archaeologists excavating, washing, numbering and classifying the finds for research. {Child's work about visit:-}"Some of the bits were ever so small. Every bit of the pots were marked where they had come from and how deep in the ground they were found. The deeper the older"
